title: Cyber Awareness Month — Beyond Blue Edition

rounds.prompt: You get an email that looks like Beyond Blue payroll asking you to 'update bank details' via a link. Best first move?

choices.text: Click the link in a sandbox
Forward to IT/Security (report phishing)
Reply asking if it’s legit
Ignore it forever

rounds.prompt: A USB stick labeled 'Staff Roster' is found in the kitchen. Safest action?

choices.text: Plug it into a spare laptop
Hand it to IT/Security for analysis
Leave it; someone will need it
Throw it in recycling

rounds.prompt: A colleague admits they reuse the same password for Beyond Blue and personal streaming. Best advice?

choices.text: Reusing is fine if it's long
Use unique passphrases + a password manager
Write them down but hide well
Rotate the same password every 6 months

rounds.prompt: Your phone is flooded with MFA prompts you didn’t initiate. What now?

choices.text: Approve one to stop the spam
Deny all and report immediately
Disable MFA for the day
Restart the phone and ignore

rounds.prompt: SUPER HARD: You inspect a 'Beyond Blue Support' email’s headers. Results: Received-SPF: softfail; Authentication-Results: dkim=pass header.d=mailer.example; dmarc=fail (p=reject) header.from=beyondblue.org.au. Best conclusion?

choices.text: Safe — DKIM passed, so it’s authentic
Likely spoofed — DMARC fail with misaligned DKIM (d=mailer.example) vs From domain; treat as phishing
Safe — From shows beyondblue.org.au
Inconclusive — click the link to verify
